question: Question_B_04_(d)
sols:
Since the reduced row form of the matrix leads to the identity we know
that there is one unique solution and it is the values in the augmented
part of the matrix. Therefore \emph{x}\textsubscript{1} = 5,
\emph{x}\textsubscript{2} = -1, and \emph{x}\textsubscript{3} = 2.
hints:
When the reduced row form of the matrix is the identity matrix, what do
you know?
